snippet: Despite many setbacks, the government has not given up its effort to make Ronell Wilson, who killed two undercover officers, the first person in the state executed in a half-century.
abstract: Extraordinary efforts to make Ronell Wilson the first person executed in New York State in 50 years are testament to brutality of his crime and political commitment to winning a seemingly ideal capital case; Justice Dept rarely explains reasons it pursues capital punishment, but several factors made case obvious candidate--Wilson and both victims were black and there was no question of guilt; timeline of pivotal events in case.
lead_paragraph: Despite many setbacks, the government has not given up its effort to make Ronell Wilson, who killed two undercover officers, the first person in the state executed in a half-century.

headline.main: Decade Later, Still Seeking a Rare New York Execution
headline.print_headline: Decade Later, Still Seeking A Rare New York Execution
